fields.description: The problem occurs if we try to update a task that is at the bottom of the page (requiring the user to scroll down to see the task).   When you click on the clock icon to update the time spent on this issue, then click on the calendar icon, it appears that the calendar is being rendered "off-screen" at the top of the page, so that you would have to scroll up in the window to be able to see the calendar at the top of the page.
fields.summary: In the TaskBoard the calendar of the worklog popup renders offset

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click Agile->Planning board.
3. Click on "new" link next to context.
4. By default "Desc" is selected. Select "ASC"

Result:
1. Both the radio buttons are selected.

Expected:
1. Only one radio button should be selected.
fields.summary: User can select both ASC and DESC radio button in new context dialog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We currently have projects as our issue type and user stories as our subtask type. We are doing this because we like the parent/child view in Planning Board. Our product team likes to setup projects and then list all the user stories that are in the project. If projects and user stories were both setup as issues, it would be hard to visually see which user stories are part of which projects.

On the planning board, is there any way to visually show the parent/child relationship? I tried using JIRA's link feature (i.e. set a user story as a child of a project), but that doesn't seem to be supported in GreenHopper?
fields.summary: Planning Board - Do any views support JIRA's issue linking?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Now that the UI bypasses the Issue Type selection window during the New Card and New Task creation process, the default seems to be the first issue type in the list alphabetically. Unfortunately, that is "Bug" and "Bug-task" for us. It is very rare that we are creating bugs from the GH interface. The vast majority of the time, it is stories and tasks we are creating. It would be great if we could set the default issue type for New Cards and New Tasks so people don't have to switch the dropdown every time.
fields.summary: Ability to set a default Issue Type when creating a new card or new task

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, when creating a new sprint, I create a new version, with a release date 3 weeks from the start date.
It would be a *nice to have* to have a button in the planning board, 'Add a new sprint after this sprint'.
As a scrummaster, I would click this button

# A dialog box pops up where you specify duration (default weeks), and main objective
# A new version is created, which starts one day after the current version, and with a release date of start date + duration.
fields.summary: As a scrummaster, I can quickly add a new version so I can plan the next sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
JC,

I did find quite a bit of requests around performance of the planning and task board.  Given that you handle each of these requests separately, I decided to create one additional request, instead of linking my issue with an existing. 


We also see noticeable performance issues with the planning and task board, and the setup is not that large as the one described in GHS-1351.
We did apply the suggestions of ([How can I improve the performance of GreenHopper?|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+FAQ#GreenHopperFAQ-HowcanIimprovetheperformanceofGreenHopper%3F]) but alas:

* vm -Xms: 512m
* vm -Xmx: 1024m
* gzip is enabled
* 2 open releases in the project (current sprint, next sprint)
* sort by is by GHRank
* number of unresolved issues < 200

The load on the server is neglectible.
Still we do have to wait in some cases for 1 minute or more before a update has been processed.
Any additional suggestions are welcome.


Secondly, I do see that some of the performance fixes are scheduled for GH4.0.  Will this new version
be backward compatible with JIRA 3.13 ?
fields.summary: Performance Planning board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
During the sprint planning meeting, we are currently moving stories from one release box to another, to check how much a certain subset would make up a good sprint.

Currently you have to change the version almost constantly to do this exercise.
It would be great that I can select a couple of unscheduled stories and see what the cost of that set is (cost being defined as estimated hours and other fields such as points and so on)
fields.summary: As a productowner or scrummaster I can 'Draw the line' in order to know if a set of stories is feasible within a sprint

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We want to use the releasenote generation of greenhoper, but we need to change the layout to our ci. 

So it would be great if it would be possible to define an custom layout of the release notes.

For us we need to change the colors, the font type and we want to add a logo.
fields.summary: Make it possible to customize the layout of the releasenotes

Can we remove the 'Charts' category?
fields.summary: Agile Gadget should not be in the 'Charts' category

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: During each sprint we have both stories that are estimated with points and timebox activities.  The pointed stories do not have a limit as to the number of hours we can put towards finishing that story, however, the timebox stories have a cap for the number of hours we spend on it.  For now, we create an issue and give it an original estimate, which is the maximum number of hours we are willing to spend on that issue, and then add subtasks to document the specifics of what we worked on.  The problem comes when we try to account for our time spent on each subtask.  If we add timespent to the sub task, Greenhopper adds that to the original estimate and we essentially burnup instead of down.  So we have developers add their time spent to the parent issue and keep the subtask at zero time.  This works as far as burning down but it does not allow us to track the time spent in each sub task, or who spent the time since we have many developers contributing to the time spent on the parent task.  It would be nice if an issue could be marked as a timebox activity with an original estimate to the time and as time is spent on subtasks it gets burned down from the parent taks instead of acumulating the total allotted time.
fields.summary: I want timebox issues

fields.summary: Submitting an issue in card view should respond to Return

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
After having used this version of the GreenHopper plugin with JIRA Professional 3.13.5 for some time (evaluation license), I purchased and installed the new licenses a couple of days ago.  Both JIRA and GreenHopper behaved properly after that.

Today I tried to import issues into JIRA from our existing Mantis system.  Since I had previously removed the Improvement issue type, I hit issue JIRA-8949.  Based on the notes in that issue I created an Improvement type and then manually updated the issuetype.ID database field to 4 and then 2 so that the import would succeed.  After doing this and restarting JIRA the imports worked and everything appeared normal in JIRA.

Except this on the Home screen which shows the GreenHopper portlet for one of the projects:

An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getSelectableChartTypes' in class com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.configurations.UserBoardsPreferences threw exception class java.lang.NullPointerException : null at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIdentifier.execute(ASTIdentifier.java:193) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.execute(ASTReference.java:175) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTReference.value(ASTReference.java:327) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Foreach.render(Foreach.java:131) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:114) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:55) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:70) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:55) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:70) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:55) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:230) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:89) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:230) at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:256) at org.apache.velocity.app.VelocityEngine.mergeTemplate(VelocityEngine.java:450) at com.atlassian.velocity.DefaultVelocityManager.getEncodedBody(DefaultVelocityManager.java:77) at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.webwork.JiraPluginWebworkVelocityServlet.service(JiraPluginWebworkVelocityServlet.java:46) at
...

This project was one I had been using with GreenHopper all along successfully, both before and after the new license.  Using the top-level GreenHopper menu item gives the same exception only in a less readable form.

Presumably there is some sort of database integrity issue, but I ran the JIRA integrity checker which found no problems.

Since GreenHopper is totally non-functional for us at this time I would appreciate some quick attention to this problem!

Thanks,
Sean
fields.summary: NullPointerException in GreenHopper plugin after Mantis import into JIRA

2. When I could get to the License page, the evaluation License is not compatible with this installation of GreenHopper.

fields.description:
Our task board is configured with 4 swim-lanes: to do, doing, fixed, and closed.

The issue burndown effectively becomes useless even though we have many issues at fixed but subject to final regression will not be fully closed.

Could this be configurable on a project-by-project basis?
fields.summary: Would like the issue burndown to be configurable by swimlane rather than hard-coded to the "DONE" column.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Please change the formatting of the chart to the JIRA style. I believe this is a trivial change as GreenHopper uses the same charting engine as JIRA.

For instance in JIRA, on a [Created vs Resolved Issue Report|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport.jspa?projectOrFilterId=project-12200&periodName=daily&daysprevious=30&cumulative=true&versionLabels=major&selectedProjectId=12200&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports%3Acreatedvsresolved-report&Next=Next], you see:

!jira-chart.png!

Whereas on GreenHopper you see:

!gh-chart.png!

Note the difference in the line thickness, colour choices, etc. Some of these options are in the User Preferences for the chart, for instance "Show Values". That should remain but the style of the chart can be changed slightly to replicate JIRA.

Thank You.
fields.summary: Make GreenHopper charts look like JIRA charts

fields.description:
Classloader problems again .....
com.atlassian.extras.common.LicenseException: de.schlichtherle.xml.PersistenceServiceException: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: de.schlichtherle.xml.G
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.old.OldLicenseDetails.getLicense(OldLicenseDetails.java:247)
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.old.OldLicenseDetails.<init>(OldLicenseDetails.java:35)
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.getLicense(GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.java:98)
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.getLicense(GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.java:70)
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.license.GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.verify(GreenHopperLicenseManagerImpl.java:42)
        at com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira.actions.LicenseAction.doSuccess(LicenseAction.java:35)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61)
        at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52)

fields.summary: GreenHopper charts x axis is offset if the start date of the chart is a non working day

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In JIRA you can specify non working days this impacts your burndown and velocity charts within the Greenhopper plug-in.

However, there is no way to specify the working days based off the country where a person or team resides.

I have teams in India, UK, Canada, Australia, Germany, Mexico, and the US and we all have different holidays. 

I'm not sure how hard this would be to implement... Specify a country/nationality when entering users/add them to a group?  Another option that could work for my team is at least allow the non-working days to be modified at a project level.  Most of my international teams work on separate projects.
fields.summary: Non Working Days should account for international teams

Getting the following stacktrace after upgrading JIRA and GreenHopper.

It only happens on the View - Version in a particular project so think its probably data related
Works fine with other projects that have been migrated.

java.lang.NullPointerException

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To reproduce:

# Create a fresh install of JIRA 4 beta 3
# Copy {{jira-greenhopper-plugin-4.0-beta3.1-jira40-complete.jar}} to {{<jira-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}}
# Go to Administration | GreenHopper License
# Enter a license (have tried both Enterprise Evaluation and Enterprise Commercial Server) and click Upload
# Bang! Stack trace attached.

Note: also seen on 4.0-beta3

Set as blocker because it renders the plugin unusable.
fields.summary: Cannot add license to 4.0-beta3.1-jira40-complete in JIRA 4.0 beta 3

fields.description:
Recently noticed that on some Windows systems running IE 8 that the iFrames display very small.

This makes them mostly useless. How can I correct this problem.

See attached screenshot to see the issue.

Note: On my system it was working fine until I needed to re-install IE8.
